data.title: Meet Our Coaches
data.meta_description: Get to know our featured Pros. Our coaches are passionate about helping employees succeed at work.
data.text:
For almost two decades, Adewale has invested his time and effort in finding ways to help professionals maximize productivity and happiness through coaching and personalized training interventions. His Bachelor’s degree in Humanistic Psychology and Master’s in Instructional Design gave him a good foundation in behavioral science and performance improvement. He has completed over 1,000 hours of coaching and designed several training programs on leadership competencies used to onboard new managers. Before venturing into coaching full time, he spent 10 years working for Fortune 50 telecommunication companies, holding individual contributor and team management roles. His unique background and experience have deeply informed his coaching with the ability to motivate, inspire, and guide my clients using my positive energy and conscious business strategy, resulting in them overcoming burnout, and regaining their drive, passion, and desire for peak performance. He's helped several clients create individual development plans, transition into new roles, define goals, create action plans, improve negotiating skills, and achieve other major outcomes they are looking for, both in their professional and personal lives. He also has extensive experience working with managers and directors to create a culture of alignment, resilience, and growth in their workplace Over the years, he's worked within diverse industries, ranging from tech companies ( e.g Google, Snap, Facebook, Intuit, and Amazon) to healthcare, manufacturing, hospitality, finance, education, telecommunications, and government. I have also partnered with several organizations in leading D&I initiatives. On the personal side, he is very involved with InterNations and other global expat organizations. The time he spent living in Russia, Belgium, and Argentina heightened his passion for international relationships and event volunteering.

As an Executive Coach I support individuals to achieve success, whatever success looks like to them, by overcoming their own limitations, understanding what are they driven by and helping them align to their ultimate purpose. My background is in business and I am qualified to the level of an MBA. I have been running my own business for the last 10 years which helped me to understand the challenges that an employer faces. Over the last years, I have been coaching employees and managers from different sectors and companies around the world and what I have discovered was that, most often the battle is given inside ourselves rather than the outside. In our journeys towards success, we strive to close the gap between who we are and who we want to become. How about yourself?

AL has 20 + years of for-profit, non-profit, and government experience. He holds a Master’s Degree in Organizational Leadership and a Professional Certified Coach Credential through the International Coach Federation. He is also a founding Board Certified Coach through the Center for Credentialing and Education. He is a remote coaching expert, having led remote teams and coached hundreds of remotely based leaders. Since he has held various positions, he has the experience that informs the powerful guidance that he provides in coaching. He asks insightful questions because he has been where you are as an IC, Manager, Director, VP, President.

A native from Panama and US Marine combat Veteran, Alex Ledgister brings to the table many years of experience. While stationed overseas, he successfully managed and coached a team of 38 Veterans from all special operations branches of the United States Military. Having overcome insurmountable odds to achieve success, Alex is able to give his clients real-world strategies and tools to maximize their personal and professional potential. As an Executive Coach and Leadership Trainer, he strives to offer the right balance of challenge and support, which is different for every person.

With a 15-year career in technology across multiple Fortune 500 companies, Alexis’ path to coaching was neither linear nor foreseen but inevitable upon reflection. Though she spent most of her career in client-facing, logic-based, analytical roles, the pandemic allowed space to pause, find out what is important to her, and pivot into a more heart-centered profession. As a result, in 2020, she pursued an M.Sc. degree in Executive Coaching and Organizational Consulting from NYU - the impetus for launching her I, Matter! Coaching and Consulting practice. Alexis initially hesitated to launch her business for various reasons, many tied to her limiting beliefs. But, she recognized that someone in the world needed her gifts, and not moving forward could deprive them of a coach who might help transform their lives. She partners with high-achieving women to advocate for themselves and find and use their voices. She is a non-judgemental cheerleader, encouraging clients through the process as they uncover potential roadblocks precluding the best version of themselves from being revealed. Many of her clients no longer connect to their inner knowing to understand what resonates for them. While others know what they want, deep-seated (conscious or unconscious) fear prevents movement. “I wanted Black and Brown women to know it was ok to take up space, in every sense of the word, to go after those dreams long since abandoned, and to put themselves first when making certain life decisions.”

As a coach, Alison understands firsthand the power of the other to help us unlock our potential. Today she brings 20+ years of combined experience as a manager and mentor, an executive, an ex-pat, a business owner, and a trained coach. Alison is known for creating a safe space for her clients to share challenges and dreams, hopes, and goals. Her coaching style is trauma-informed and resilience-focused. She guides clients to uncover new possibilities and make actionable plans to craft habits, goals, and communication to promote flourishing at work and in life. She loves job crafting and coaching non-traditional leaders and managers to build the confidence and worldview they need to succeed and thrive with joy.

PhD, Conflict Analysis and Resolution; MPA, HR Management; Professional Certified Coach (PCC); SHRM Senior Certified Professional Angela is a certified coach through the International Coach Federation with 20 years of leadership experience. As a principal in her firm, she partners with individuals and organizations from diverse industries and geographical locations through coaching, group facilitation, professional development training and organizational conflict management services. She is a compassionate and provoking thought-partner, who supports and challenges others in becoming more self-aware, in fully exploring their interests and needs, and in creating both the vision and action plan to leverage their strengths in favor of their personal and professional goals.

MS, Organizational Behavior and Executive Coaching; Professional Certified Coach (PCC); ACTP Certified Coach Anitha brings more than 15 years of diverse experience to her coaching practice. After starting her career in the field of information technology. After beginning to help others with self-improvement, career growth, executive function, communication strategies, and culture change, she shifted her career focus to coaching. Through her work as an executive coach, Anitha guides perpetually-unsatisfied goal-setters to celebrate what’s going right, tap into the now without judgment, and cultivate self-compassion. Her mission is to help people be happier and more successful.

With an international career in HR and business development spanning 4 countries and 2 continents, Annette brings an international and inclusive perspective to coaching. She loves coaching employees at any stage of their career to gain clarity around personal and professional goals and bring out their best in new situations. Annette is Dutch, married to a Swede and lives just outside New York, USA. She loves to be active outdoors or snuggle up indoors with a good book! Annette is an ICF ACC coach and is proud to be a Bravely Coach.

Now an Executive & Leadership Coach, Arielle is a former management consultant and has worked across various industries including financial services, education, technology, and telecommunications. She transitioned to coaching in 2018, and is a certified professional coach and is ICF-credentialed PCC (Professional Certified Coach). She is the founder of her own coaching and consulting firm, where she helps individuals and companies realize their potential. Arielle leverages her international background to bring a diverse and multifaceted perspective to her coaching. She specializes in helping her clients to build confidence, develop their communication and leadership skills, and carve out fulfilling career paths. She received her BA in English from Tufts University and her MBA from Tel Aviv University Coller School of Management. She lives in NYC.

An award-winning Executive Leadership coach, D&I coach, Change management professional, mental health practitioner, Master NLP, Neuroscience & Mindfulness Researcher, Author and Speaker with extensive experience developing global leaders across 30 countries. Asma has worked with senior leaders including C-suite and executive management, Directors and VP’s, senior and mid-level managers in Technology, Consulting, Healthcare, Broadcasting, Retail, Ecommerce, Entrepreneurship, Leisure & Hospitality, ONGC and Banking industries as well as non-profits and academia. Asma was awarded the World’s Best Top 100 Global Coaching Leaders by CHRO Asia and World Coaching Congress in 2017. Whether it is about anti-racism, anti-oppression in the US to structural diversity, gender diversity in EMEA, to the very local nuances of cultural assimilation in APAC, Asma enjoys nurturing the spaces of belonging and inclusivity across the world.

Benedek is an ambitious and motivated senior organizational development expert, coach and team coach with extensive practical experience in the Learning and Development function of HR. A former marketing agency account and strategy director, he also has a wide understanding of different businesses and their inner workings. As an ICF licensed, PCC level business coach and corporate trainer, he prides himself on quickly understanding how and where people and teams are ‘stuck’ and providing them with the right toolkit to grow and progress. He finds joy in getting his clients to access their next best versions.

Ben comes to Bravely with nearly a decade of experience working at start ups large and small, from Uber to a 10-person pre-seed team. What’s most important to know about Ben is that before he was a career coach, he was someone who really needed a career coach. Luckily, he found a couple of mentors at Bravely who guided him through the trying passages of early career into mid-career. Being a coachee-turned professional coach, he approaches conversations with empathy, humility and curiosity. Whatever you’re going through right now, he will not pretend to have the answer. Ben does believe you have the answer, and together we can test hypotheses and get closer to that answer.

PhD in Human and Organizational Systems; MA in Organization Development, Fielding Graduate University Beth Banks Cohn is an experienced consultant, coach and trainer with experience in IT, manufacturing, sales, marketing, operations, leadership development and training. Beth has worked and consulted in the Life Sciences, Technology, Engineering and Retail industries. Beth loves to coach individuals who feel stuck in their careers or who trying to build new skills. She is certified in the Kolbe Index, the only tool that measures how we instinctively take action when we are trying to solve a problem.

Professional Certified Coach (PCC) ICF-certified; EQi 2.0 and EQi 360 Certified Assessor; Executive Coach Certification (XCC); MS, Organization Development and Leadership BethAnne helps leaders at all levels discover and develop their own unique skill set and strengths to get the most from themselves and their teams. She supports them in their journey to be more conscious and effective leaders and facilitates clear awareness on vision, goals, balance, and accountability. BethAnne comes from an international business background and holds a masters degree in leadership and organizational development and is certified as a professional coach, PCC, from ICF.

With a wealth of knowledge and experience from the long journey of starting from the bottom and reaching the top, as CEO in a multinational company, Betti has a good understanding of the various challenges people face in their careers, such as : work life balance, interpersonal relationship, developing team, developing leadership diversity, overcoming failure etc. Betti finds this experience very useful in coaching. Her passion is to develop people and their leadership skills. Watching people grow, realizing their best potential and succeeding in their lives is her greatest pleasure. As a Certified Executive Coach, Betti coaches leaders of all levels on how to grow as a person and inspire as a leader.

For over three years, I have coached senior executives from a wide variety of sectors in Asia. My clients span from venture capital, high tech, automotive, e-commerce, construction, education, to nonprofits. I have served in a series of executive HR roles in multinational companies in the past 25 years. With the experience of building a foreign enterprise team in auto parts industry from zero to one and supporting its rapid development, I pay close attention to target management and have strong capability in plan execution which effectively promotes customer awareness. Since March 2019, I studied Professional Coaching Program and I have completed 275 ICF ACTP learning hours. As an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC) , I have served for many multinational corporations, including Warburg Pincus, Michelin China, Vipshops and Jiangsu Libert, etc. I love workout and traveling, and I always focus on self-development and growth. I have an excellent daughter who graduated from Johns Hopkins University with two master degrees. 在过去的三年中，我曾为亚洲多国经理和总裁级客户提供教练服务。我的客户来自于风险投资、高科技、汽车、电子商务、建筑、教育和非营利组织等行业。我拥有二十五年以上的职场经验，历任跨国公司人力资源总监、亚洲区人力资源项目运营、人力资源行政经理、中国区招聘经理等不同职能。我具有从零到一搭建汽车零部件行业外企团队并支持企业高速发展的经历，因此注重目标管理、落地能力强，能够高效地推动客户觉察度。 自2019年3月起，我学习了教练技术，已完成275小时的专业教练培训小时数。作为国际教练联盟认证的专业教练 (PCC)，我曾为华平投资、米其林中国、唯品会和利柏特等公司提供教练服务。 Helen热爱生活，爱好健身和旅游，注重不断地自我学习，持续成长。有一位毕业于美国约翰霍普金斯大学并获双硕士学位的优秀女儿。

Bob brings more than two decades of diverse leadership experience to his coaching practise. He has held management and ownership roles in Retail, Tourism, and Economic Development throughout his career. His non-linear career path took him to the Cayman Islands to live and work in his 30’s, returned to University as a mature learner at age 40, which led him on a personal development journey that continues today. Bob focuses on leadership and personal development coaching. He is passionate about serving driven professionals who value increased self-awareness, clarity, and alignment in their lives. He employs reflective inquiry to help clients uncover inner and outer blocks and helping them discover what solutions may be possible.

MS, Leadership; ICF Certified Coach; Stanford Ignite Certificate of Innovation Brandon empowers leaders to create significance by designing alignment between purpose and action. A 2x founder in the Coaching & Consulting space, he has coached diverse leaders at Fortune 500 companies, start-ups, military and sports organizations, and in higher education. His design-centered coaching leverages curiosity, candor, and compassion - principles refined during his tenure as a coach and faculty member at the Center for Creative Leadership, Center for Character and Leadership Development, and other world-renowned institutions. Prior to his career as a certified coach Brandon learned the art and science of courageous leadership and unrelenting professionalism while serving as a decorated combat pilot, flight instructor, leadership consultant, and football coach in the U.S. Air Force and as a U.S. Senate staffer.

Britt has a background working with various startups in Chicago and New York focusing on workplace experience. In 2019, she expanded her view of what workplace wellness and employee engagement has the potential to be by getting trained as a professional coach. She's since then coached several clients in her own business, worked side by side with a Silicon Valley advisor supporting tech startup founders, and has also done career coaching at a coding bootcamp for aspiring tech engineers. In addition to her time at Bravely, Britt manages People Ops for a quickly growing fully remote startup. She also is a volunteer facilitator for the year round WBECS Coaching Summit. Britt holds a BA in Communications from Malone University and a HR Certification from Cornell University, is an ICF accredited coach and has been trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction. She is regularly found listening to every audiobook she can find on interpersonal communication, leadership, and self-growth.

Carla is an open-minded and curious person, passionate about connecting with others and pursuing a life of learning and personal growth. She truly believes in people’s ability to grow and change into whatever version of themselves they envision. She enjoys working with curious, driven people who want to achieve their full potential and overcome self doubt and insecurities. Her clients describe her as warm and empathetic and appreciate her positive energy and support to make traction towards their goals. She has over 15 years of experience working in international environments in management consulting and tech startups as a strategy and operations leader. Carla led multi cultural and remote teams, and was recognized as a highly empathetic and effective leader. She is a certified professional coach through the Co-active Training Institute and holds an MBA from Berkeley Haas and a MS in electrical engineering. Carla is originally from Barcelona, and after having lived for over 8 years in California she is now settled in Amsterdam where she lives with her husband and two young boys.

Cathleen is a Leadership Coach who is curious about people and about everything that makes them 'tick'. Characterised by aspiration and the pursuit of excellence, pace and constant change, Cathleen’s career has been shaped by her passion for a better understanding of what it takes to be at our best, and what it takes to help other people around us be at their best. She spent 15 years as a leader in international, matrix-structured organisations supporting leaders and teams in transition, and individuals through their personal development and growth paths through coaching and leadership development.

After two decades in HR and management consulting, Christi made a pivot to focus on executive coaching. She had much to learn as an entrepreneur and harnessed her ability to use technology, network and connect to create a successful coaching business on her own terms that align with her values. She loves to work with professionals who are high performers, courageous, driven and intentional and want more. She knows that coaching is and consulting are in her blood, both help create success for herself and others and always enjoys seeing her clients create a vision for what's possible for them.

Christine has a passion for helping people live more meaningful and vibrant lives by unlocking their greatest potential and purpose. In her roles as a life coach and an organizational and leadership development coach she provides the safe space for individuals to create their own conscious transformation. She brings 20 years of collective and diverse experience to her coaching practice. She has a doctorate in clinical psychology and comes to coaching with a background in psychotherapy. She uses a strength-based approach to help empower individuals to live authentically and to thrive in all areas of their life. Her work is strongly guided by a holistic and cultural lens as she is multilingual and multicultural and has worked within diverse groups and organizations globally.

Christy enjoys supporting individuals and teams in their ongoing growth. With specialties in leadership development and cultural diversity/inclusion, she provides coaching that creates effective individuals, leaders and teams in support of an organization’s strategy and mission. Christy highly values her experiences working throughout the US, Europe and Asia. She is passionate about developing diverse teams, working across cultural, generational, and gender differences. As gender culture specialist, Christy’s experience ranges from one-on-one coaching to being a keynote speaker in multiple major organizations. Christy has partnered with individuals at all levels of an organization, from new supervisors to senior leaders in identifying their path for growth and improvement. Her coaching philosophy is to meet the individual where they are, without judgement, and providing support to find the direction that best suits them.

Christy has a MSW, is an Associated Certified Coach, holds a Chartered Advisor in Philanthropy designation and has over 20 years of experience in roles in the business, education and nonprofit sectors. Throughout her career, she has supported others through developing insight to what is most meaningful to them and how they can execute that vision utilizing their strengths and values. Christy lives in Southwestern PA and loves to explore the world through stories.

Cindy loves people, places and performance. For over a decade, she held a full-load, corporate HR career in Germany and the US. On top of leading a team, she worked closely with Senior Executives of a German DAX30 to solve people and culture challenges around the world. In 2019, she decided to make a shift, serve a wider community of leaders and spend more time in Australia, her partner's home country. Since then, she uses her brave, energetic and optimistic style to help people around the world transition into the life they want. She is the founder of Blue Mountains Coaching and is based in Leura, Australia, on Darug and Gundungurra country.

Cindy is a people and organizational development consultant, transformation catalyst and coach, and community builder who enjoys bringing joy, health, and love to individuals and groups. She takes a holistic approach to creating a safe space for clients to co-create their learning journey. It includes cognitive, emotional, relational, and somatic capacities beyond coaching tools and technics to bring her presence in coaching conversations. With over 15 years of HR consulting and leadership roles, mainly in Asia-Pacific regions, Cindy supports business leaders to be effective and bring their authentic selves into their teams and organizations. At Bravely, she enjoys meeting clients from all over the world with their unique stories and gifts, facilitating their personal and professional growth, and developing herself continuously as a whole person with clients to live a more fulfilling life every day.

Costas is an International Coaching Federation accredited coach. He holds a Maritime Economics and Theatre Studies degree. He loves working with people that are Managing Change or transitioning in their lives. He has done a lot of work on Effective Communication and feels very passionate about DEI practices. A proud member of the LGBTQ+ community and a Steering Committee member of Coach Activism. He holds many years of experience in the aviation industry and the non profit world. Speaks English, Italian and Greek, has relocated a few times and loves to hear about your journeys.

Danielle is a Professional Certified Coach by the ICF with 15 years of diverse experiences in corporations and executive coaching. She is a former engineer and start-up founder who leveraged her knowledge in business process improvement to drive change in her various strategic roles in manufacturing and product development. As a US expat in Spain, she is accustomed to working with and coaching various cultures. Danielle pairs her extensive professional experience with her coaching expertise to provide coaching that is grounded and practical. She helps leaders challenge their comfort level, express themselves more constructively, and align their behavior with their goals.

David Johnson, Ed.D. is a teacher, professor, consultant, and coach. He has worked in corporate and non-profit settings as a leader, supervisor, and manager. He has inspired people and has taught and trained in varied settings. He is also a U.S. Air Force Reserve veteran who served in Operations Iraqi Freedom and Enduring Freedom and who began as a “slick sleeve” and achieved colonel. He holds a doctorate from Indiana University and completed the International Coach Federation accredited Executive and Professional Certificate Coaching Program at the University of Texas-Dallas. He is a lifelong learner who embraces diversity and inclusion.

David's background includes over twenty-five years of talent management and development, coaching, training, and global human resource leadership experience in profit and non-profit organizations. He transitioned to HR after working as a behavior therapist and now focuses on individual and organization behavior in the workplace. His behaviorist background equips him with a deep commitment to his clients. He is a certified Executive Coach and a Master Practitioner in MBTI and Emotional Intelligence in Leadership. David is passionate about helping organizations and individuals at every stage in an organization to grow, develop, and succeed.

Dominic Saintfort has over 10 years of experience as a coach, HR professional, and as a consultant. He coached employees at a number companies that include General Electric, Tesla, Deloitte and Facebook. He is entrepreneurial and runs his own human capital consulting and coaching business in Los Angeles. Coaching is one of Dominic's passions and strengths. He has coached employees at all levels and is a calming force that is adept at helping people through difficult issues and situations. Dominic prides himself in being a partner and helping people with self-discovery and taking intentional action to drive change in their lives.

After beginning her career as a Licensed Psychologist in Finland and getting advanced training in individual and group coaching, Eeva bravely(!) pivoted her career after locating to the US and has since worked in various People Operations roles in technology, hospitality and professional services. With over a decade of coaching experience in different fields, she focuses on supporting and empowering her coachees to find answers they seek from within, adding clarity and balanced outlook to each individual situation and challenge. Eeva continues her path as a life long learner and has most recently received certifications in Meditation and Diversity & Inclusion.

Liz's passion for coaching is rooted in her commitment to building highly trusting teams and workplace cultures that nurture an internal talent pipeline. After 12+ yrs growing teams as a senior leader with organizations in the education sector, she founded her leadership coaching and consulting firm. She believes leadership isn't luck, it's learned. She equips her clients with the systems and structures to unlock their team's highest potential and drive impact. She brings in principles of positive psychology and community to help individuals and teams navigate transition with confidence and lead authentically. She is known for her highly personable and engaging approach. She's a Certified CliftonStrengths Coach and facilitator of the Immunity to Change coaching process at Harvard University.

Ericka is an experienced Career Coach, author, former Hiring Manager and Career Readiness Adjunct Professor with a BA in Management (Concentration in Human Resources) as well as an Interviewing Certificate from the University of TX at Austin. She has launched an online course platform that positions clients around the globe to incorporate clarity and manage their career like a business. These experiences which include well over a decade of leadership experience as a hiring manager uniquely positions Ericka to provide clients with the relevant knowledge and support needed to maximize their career and achieve success.

Evangelos is a coach with a passion on leadership and personal development. He is based in London and has a track record of almost 20 years in the Human Resources field. He has experience working with professionals at different career levels and functions such as HR, sales, operations, accounting & finance, data science, law and strategy. His coaching philosophy is that leadership development is about leading yourself by knowing yourself. He enjoys working with clients that have a positive outlook about life and a growth mindset, there are curious about themselves and want to invest in their development.

For more than a decade, Evett has worked with a diverse range of people around the world in multiple industries with various cultures and backgrounds. She comes from a strong background in counseling, outplacement, HR, business, and coaching, focusing on management, recruitment, learning and development, and retention. She has also worked as a Senior Career Educator working closely with the University to embed employability as part of their curriculum. Her unique understanding of the barriers and influences that impact creating change allows her to build a holistic and personalized response for each client and makes her an ideal collaborator.

Drawing upon 25+ years in the nonprofit, academic, and corporate sectors and her entrepreneurial journey, Galia has honed her consulting, coaching, and facilitating skills. Galia is an expert specializing in fundraising, strategy execution, talent development, and team, executive, and board coaching—working within both the corporate and NGO sectors. Her diverse, multicultural, lived experiences enable her to be comfortable working in any space, industry, and with any leader—regardless of status or experience. Galia is a natural connector. Her passion for empowering others is unshakable. Galia is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) through the International Coaching Federation, Conscious Business Institute Certified™, a Step into Your Moxie® Certified Facilitator, an Everything DiSC® Certified Practioner, Energy Index (ELI) Master Practitioner, a COR.E Transitions Dynamics Specialist, and a Certified Professional Coach from iPEC. BA. Guilford College and an M.S.Ed. The University of Miami.

Gretchen (she/her) specializes in helping people expand their self-awareness and self-acceptance so they can live richer, more effective lives. She also enjoys working with folks on useful feedback techniques and strategies for effective communication and conflict engagement. She is a military veteran with experience in emergency management, social work, non-profit leadership, mediation/conflict resolution, personal development coaching, and group facilitation of many flavors. Gretchen is committed to diversity and inclusion, even when it’s “messy” or feels scary. Last, but not least, she is a pleasant human and happens to love high-fives!

ICF (ACC) and EMCC Certified Executive and Performance Coach/ Life Coach; NLP, Mindfulness & Cognitive Behavior Practitioner Gunjan has a unique approach to coaching. While her focus is on supporting individuals to develop leadership acumen and achieving professional/personal goals, her art inspired dynamic methods and creative interactions are what stand her apart. With an extensive background of 15 yrs as an HR Consultant in Services, Manufacturing, IT and Consumer Goods industries with MNCs in US, UK, SG, Australia, NZ, Vietnam, HK, Thailand & India; she has worked in the areas of employee relations, people & organization transformation, performance management and communications strategy. In three words, she can be described as Empathetic, Focused and Flexible.

Hana has over 10 years of business experience globally, mostly working for big international organizations. Lived in 6 different countries and speaks fluently 3 different languages. Through this diverse cultural, business and personal background she learned how to adjust easily, be open and empathetic with others. Hana is energetic, optimistic, love to learn and inspire others. Hana helps team leaders to smoothly transition in their career and to become the best leader they can be. She is mostly coaching team leaders and executive in global organizations but also anyone eager to grow, develop or improve their day to day life. Her areas of specialization: Transition coaching, Growth mindset and Limiting believes, Positive intelligence, Leadership, Work & Life balance, Conflict resolution, Time management Her life purpose is to motivate people with positive and grow mindset so that together we succeed in any challenges of our life.

Hans Kohler holds a M.S. in Negotiation and Conflict Resolution from Columbia University, where he specialized in Interpersonal Relationships and how to use Effective Communication and Emotional Intelligence to prevent unhealthy conflicts. Hans is a Conflict Resolution Specialist, Ombuds, Facilitator, Conflict Coach and Mediator. Hans has worked in multiple areas from International Organizations to the LA Superior Court to Recovery and Mental Health institutions, as well as teaching Conflict Resolution to companies, students, people, and families. He also has worked on the DEIB space, where his focus is on creating space, voices, representation for all. Hans is originally from Brazil and speaks six languages, as well as he has lived in five different countries hence becoming more culturally aware of differences and commonalities.

Hector brings 9+ years of experience in developing talent to his coaching practice. As a key part of LinkedIn's Leadership Development team, Hector's expertise spans executive coaching, all level of career conversations and overall skills development. He passionately believes every one is creative, resourceful, and whole and brings a practical and earnest approach to coaching that allows his coachees to unlock their own potential. Living in Stamford, CT, his coaching skills are probably best tested by his 2 year old son.

Irina is a coach and thinking partner who helps clients tap into their inner resources to create authentic solutions. With 20 years of experience in the tech industry, she combines her expertise in leadership and technology with her coaching skills to help clients grow both personally and professionally. Irina supports clients in developing their careers, overcoming obstacles, honing their soft skills, managing complex projects, resolving conflicts, and adapting to new roles. Her friendly and empathetic coaching style puts clients at ease, making it easy to discuss topics ranging from clarifying career goals to developing effective leadership skills. Irina works collaboratively with clients to find tailored solutions that fit their unique needs. She is an Associate Certified Coach by the International Coach Federation (ICF) and a Certified Team Coach by CoachingUp University.

Jaclyn brings over 19 years of experience in both Coaching & HR/Labor Relations. Through her extensive experience with executives & professionals, she has developed a unique ability to help clients identify core values & motivators. She collaborates with clients in developing career & performance goals to achieve progressive success. Jaclyn brings a broad base of industry experience, which helps her connect with each client to support advancement & success in their profession. She customizes her approach to each client, as they build the skills required for the next stage in their career. She finds joy in helping people identify solutions.

Jennifer is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) with the International Coaching Federation, and has her MA in Organizational Leadership. She has extensive experience in Human Resources where she learned the benefits of coaching and how it enhances the engagement of employees in the workplace. Her specialty is career coaching, and working with clients on defining their career goals, whether its growth within their current role or transitioning into a new role. Jennifer’s Strengths Finders top 5 strengths include Learner, Developer, Achiever, Responsibility, and Empathy. She strives to utilize these strengths to support individual development and growth.

Jeny Androukaki, MBA Professional Development Coach ICF-ACC I am an experienced Professional Development Coach collaborating with my clients towards their aspirations, seeing the people as a whole, valuing the richness of diverse people and different mindsets, understanding corporate environment and small business world, where change is the new constant. I have worked with a variety of clients, individuals and teams towards performance and leadership skills development, drive for results, career transitions, well-being and work-life balance. My clients come from different industries (Financial, Law, (Fin)Tech, Marketing, Pharma, Consulting, Government, NGOs, more..) Believing that the clients are capable to make their own change and find their own solutions, I encourage accountability and extract the learning from within. Having adopted a strengths based approach, I enable people proceed towards their future focused, with self-confidence, acceptance and resilience.

Jill Sarah has been supporting employees in the workplace for the past 25 years. Her career began in occupational health where she provided safety trainings for staff at all levels in a large teaching medical center. While at the medical center, she became an employee advocate and noticed she had a knack for understanding differing perspectives. Jill Sarah later studied mediation and conflict resolution at Eastern Mennonite University and the Harvard Negotiation Insight Initiative. A certified mediator in the Transformative style of mediation, when she is not mediating or coaching, Jill Sarah enjoys her passion for dance and the out-of-doors

Jim is an Executive Leadership Coach, Business Mentor & Wellbeing Consultant with 20+ yrs in business strategy, digital marketing, and entrepreneurship, including a depth of experience in digital tech, corporation and entrepreneurship and founder of his own sustainable international business. He coaches at all levels from team, managerial to executive, specializing in authentic leadership, career development, healthy organizational cultures, focusing on health and mental wellbeing coaching. He acts as your thinking and listening partner to help you gain deeper insights, focus, and clarity, to explore your challenges and ways to grow confidently to fulfill your potential and be the change you want to see. He is trained with Animas ICF diploma in transformational coaching, natural mindfulness facilitator, eco-therapist and you will often find him guiding forest bathing walks in the woodlands in West Sussex in U.K

Joanna's background is in Business education and Adult Learning and she brings 25 years of diverse experience to her coaching. Joanna's background is in Business education and Adult Learning and she brings 25 years of diverse experience to her coaching. She is accredited as a Senior Practitioner coach with the European Mentoring and Coaching Council. She started her career teaching English in Japan and has worked in Higher Education for many years, most recently teaching 'Managing Change' on an undergraduate degree. She is UK-based and loves working remotely with clients around the world in various industries and at all levels. Her passion is to make workplaces better, happier and healthier through developing employee skills in the workplace. She is constantly learning and developing herself in anything to do with organisational behaviour and coaching.

Joanne is a leadership and negotiation coach working with motivated folx to be effective, confident leaders and get paid their worth. Joanne earned an MBA from the Robinson College of Business at Georgia State University. Her executive coach training was through the Teleos Coach Development Program. She is a Professional Certified Coach via the International Coach Federation. In addition, she has completed the Playing Big Facilitators Training with Tara Mohr. She discovered Bravely in 2018 at a tech conference and worked for a year to get on their roster. Bravely speaks to Joanne's goal of providing equitable and effective leadership coaching since it's available when folx need it most and free of charge to employees, apart from medical coverage it really is the best benefit a company can provide. Joanne lives in the state of freedom and unity, Vermont with her partner, two amazing kids and two goofy dogs.

Joe pivoted to a full-time coaching career after a successful 24-year run in Commercial insurance sales and coaching. A Certified Life Coach, he is passionate about helping clients maximize their strengths and utilize their abilities to thrive and do their best work. Everyone possesses the ability to be great. He regularly works with clients that are: · First time managers · Considering a move from I.C. to Management · Navigating uncertainty in their company · Seeking help navigating ADHD · Looking to eliminate drama at work Joe knows that how we see ourselves and how we relate to those around us has a dramatic impact on our outlook and productivity. This is often the cause of stress in our careers. He is an Empowerment Dynamic Certified Trainer, and Certified Coach; a magnificent framework that addresses the drama we can find ourselves in when engaging with peers, direct reports, and managers. Joe is a Certified Life Coach as well. He maintains his own coaching practice where he has a personal interest in helping adults with ADHD and those with Addictive Behavior in their recovery journey.

John has dedicated his career toward helping empower individuals during complicated situations. Since receiving a Master's of Dispute Resolution from Pepperdine School of Law, his focus has revolved around conflict resolution, mediation, and the Ombuds field. He has worked with both individuals and a range of diverse organizations. As a Bravely Pro, his focus is to create a space where an employee can feel free to share any type of concern they may be dealing with. John aims to tailor an approach to the situation that is supportive, and incorporates an employee's unique context and goals.

Kashia Dunner is a consultant and coach who is passionate about intentional, value-aligned career design. She is a former diplomat who also has experience working in tech, non-profits, and higher education as both a manager and individual contributor. Her diverse and global career experience allows her to bring a fresh and inquisitive approach to coaching, helping clients discover solutions that advance their goals. Kashia’s areas of expertise as a coach include workplace boundaries and time management; managing adult ADHD; and navigating organizational changes. Kashia earned bachelor’s degrees in Political Science and Latin American Studies from the College of Charleston and a MA from The George Washington University in Latin American and Hemispheric Studies.

Transformational coach specialized in personal leadership style, work-life balance and navigating uncertainty. International Coaching Federation Certified ACC 500+ hours Coach with 20+ years of leadership experience, Kat is offering a luminous nature of her presence to support startup-to-senior managers and individual contributors in their art of creating change. It takes a great conversation to soak into deeper realms of what is possible and navigate them steadily - and Kat’s guidance is phenomenal. After a decade of being told she is natural born leader, she boldly transitioned from architecture to coaching and - these waters feel amazing ! Genuinely curious about human potential, she stays very true about her own exhaustion episodes and hears your talking in between the lines. As a leadership coach, trainer and speaker, she is specially keen on supporting her clients towards finding hope, reinforcing individual accomplishment and creating stronger impact. She had successfully served companies like US Air Force, Visa, Four Seasons Hotels, Phillip Morris Int, Mars, Novartis or Ball Corporation. Living and dreaming her best life anywhere between discipline and surrender, you may meet her in the woods with her kiddos or running NYC marathon.

Kathleen has a passion for empowering others. She believes that everyone is powerful, with unique gifts to share. With a Masters' Degree in Special Education, she began her career coaching students on becoming self-aware, confident and eager to grow. She studied and created nonviolent communication, social justice, wellness, resiliency, and happiness initiatives. In previous leadership roles and currently, through her business, she coaches members of school communities, workplaces, and families. Her coaching style is supportive, genuine and encouraging. She listens with empathy and care. Her clients set the agenda and course for each session; then, she helps them explore ideas, perspectives, priorities and opportunities. Trained by Harvard Mediation Program, Non-Violent Communication, Empathy Circles, and various coaching programs, Kathleen loves learning about and supporting others. In her free time, she enjoys travel, yoga, music, comedy, and walking her rescue dog, Norman.

Kathy is a bilingual coach (Mandarin/English) and receives her credential from the International Coaching Federation (ICF). Before she pursued her passion in the personal development field, Kathy was a marketing professional with 12 years of business background in media and IT industry. Over the past years, through her work as a professional coach, Kathy has worked with individuals all over the world and partnered with them for safe exploration and deeper clarification. She supports and empowers her clients to clarify their challenges, identify their goals, and fully unleash their potential to live fulfilling and courageous lives.

Kelly Lynn Adams is a Certified Executive, Leadership & Life Coach, Business Strategist, Speaker, Writer & Podcaster. Kelly Lynn has helped thousands of high-achieving leaders manage their mindset, maximize their time and monetize & shift in their businesses & lives. Kelly Lynn has worked with Fortune 500 executives, leaders, entrepreneurs & business owners for 18+ years driving impact & profitability across diverse cultures and settings. She helps her clients create transformation that is life changing, helps them get out of their own way, grow, thrive, create impact, and influence in order to get to their untapped potential. Kelly Lynn helps her clients redefine success, elevate their performance through shifting their thoughts, increasing their confidence, stepping into their power, and supersizing their self-love all with more ease, flow, speed, joy and love. Kelly Lynn’s transformational coaching, speaking, and success secrets are often sought out by the media.

Ken has dedicated his life to helping people build better relationships and changing life circumstances by leverages 25 years of experience help clients realize their potential and live the life they’ve always wanted. As a Bravely Pro Ken believe that people work perfectly, and we all have what we need to achieve our goals. The key is learning and understanding the steps and direction to take to get there. This is where Ken comes in, building a relationship filled with respect, rapport, and curiosity.

BS Marketing / MS Leadership and Organizational Development / Professional Certified Coach (PCC) International Coaching Federation Kimberly spent more than 15 years working in the Consumer Packaged Goods Industry across various roles in Marketing, Sales, and Business Development. Through leading diverse teams and serving as a mentor over the years, Kimberly discovered her true passion was helping individuals traverse their current work environment by building their personal brand and developing action plans to accomplish their goals. As a Professional Certified Coach, her ultimate goal is to help clients live their best life by interweaving their passion and strengths to create a tailored path leading to the achievement of their desired professional and personal goals.

Krista brings more than 15 years experience to her coaching clients. Before beginning as a Bravely Pro, Krista was the HR director at a business she owns and operates in Minnesota. She also served for 14 years as the Marketing Director before beginning her own coaching practice where she was able to bring her experience to other businesses professionals. Krista is also a certified success trainer and speaker. As a Bravely Pro, Krista loves coaching employees with a focus on accountability and action.

Laura is a Registered Coaching Psychologist with the British Psychological Society. She has 12 years of diverse workplace, educational and personal coaching experience across a broad range of contexts. Laura is the Chair of the Special Group in Coaching Psychology with the British Psychological Society. As a Doctor of Philosophy, she also works as a Senior Lecturer in Coaching Psychology and holds a PhD in Applied Psychology, Behaviour Change. In previous employment she has worked in sales and finance. Laura loves helping employees to gain clarity from their sessions, and to set clear and actionable next steps.

Laurence partners a-players, managers and leaders to unlock their full potentiel. She helps her clients perform and feel confortable in unconfortable situations, like high level athletes going to the olympics. With her they clarify their goals and train during and in between sessions. With a specific and personnalize approach she helps them overcome SMARTs goals and achieve concrete results. With more than 33 years of corporate experience as a project leader in I.T, she understands a wide range of context and bring tools such as Leadership’s signature, Vivid vision, Non violent communication, Agile framework, Reflected best self and Growth mindset. Personnal and professional certified coach she also hosts a weekly podcast named Happywin about personal development and leadership.

Libby is passionate about creating strengths-based organizations to attract the best talent, retain top performers, and maximize everyone’s potential. She has over twenty years of experience as a leader, consultant, and talent coach in healthcare, education, and technology. Libby has started HR departments and helped them scale through various change management initiatives. Background and Industry Experience Libby is a seasoned professional coach and experienced executive leader. Her roles have ranged from leading employee engagement processes, developing and implementing HR systems, facilitating integration following mergers and acquisitions, and coaching executive teams through organizational changes. Libby has experience leading both 100% distributed and hybrid teams and helping them feel connected to a company’s mission. Coaching Approach Libby has been coaching individuals and teams, both internally and externally, since 2001. She is certified as a strengths coach with The Gallup Organization and a Health and Life Coach with The Health Coach Institute. Key areas of interest and experience for Libby include helping individuals and teams learn more about what they do best and casting talent to allow them to use their strengths regularly in their work. Libby is an outcome-focused coach who likes to help executives understand their goals for success and achieve them. She believes that data should help guide development conversations. Education and Professional Affiliations: • BA in Communications and Organizational Development from The Ohio State University • Certified Health and Life Coach, Health Coach Institute • Certified Strengths Coach, The Gallup Organization • Professional in Human Resources (PHR), Society for Human Resources Management (SHRM) • Active member of Northeast Area Human Resources Association (NEHRA) and SHRM

I partner with managers and emerging leaders to gain clarity and focus, identify obstacles, reduce overwhelm, create strategic actions and implement for desired outcomes. I come to you with 20 years of experience working in organizational transformation and education for school districts and Johns Hopkins University, so my specialty is strategic planning and implementation. I hold a Graduate Certificate in Executive and Professional Coaching from University of Texas at Dallas School of Management and am an ICF certified coach. My goal as a coach is to help you gain clarity, find solutions, and take actions to become your best self.

Lidia is a Certified Coach (ACC) through International Coaching Federation (ICF), based in Indonesia. She brings 20+ years of progressive experience in Human Resources & Development in multinational companies and is attuned in communicating with people of various backgrounds and cultures. Her holistic approach of growing and explorative brings clarity, direction, and positive support for her clients. Lidia helps clients live their best life, by filling the gap between where they are now, and where they want to be. By identifying where growth is desired, setting goals and objectives, and holding accountability. Lidia helps her clients reach each milestone, one at a time with an ultimate end goal of satisfaction and success, reach their highest goals and dreams.

20 years ago Lou tapped into something that (at the time) he didn't realize was his true source of happiness. It took several stumbles and bumps, over a few years, to identify that helping people, to become successful in life, created such great energy and happiness for him --> his TRUE passion, Coaching. Lou has been assisting people become more successful, by enabling them to identify and create the happiness they so deserve by coaching, mentoring and leading people, teams and organizations across various industries and through different levels of personal goals.

Lynda Tarras is an Executive and Leadership Coach that is passionate about helping leaders to transform conversations, cultures, and organizations. She holds a Graduate Certificate in Executive and Professional Coaching from the University of Texas at Dallas and is certified by the International Coaching Federation as a PCC. She is also a Conversational Intelligence® coach, an ExPI Certified Practitioner (Bates Executive Presence 360), and a Systemic Team Coach. Prior to becoming a full-time coach, Lynda worked for many years as a human resource executive, known for transforming business operations, engaging stakeholders, effecting change, and building leadership and organizational capacity.

Certified professional life coach trained in cognitive behavioral therapy and trauma-sensitive coaching with expertise in communication strategies helping clients find their voices, prioritize what really matters and refocus. A graduate of Bennett College for Women with a degree in English; I am an author, coach, mentor and entrepreneur. For 20 years, I worked in higher education and administration, until making the decision to launch my coaching firm in 2019. My coaching philosophy centers on self-awareness, confidence and empathy. Through research-based mindfulness, Cognitive Behavioral Therapy and trauma-focused techniques, as well as positive thinking, I help clients to make small changes for big impact both personally and professionally. My coaching style is Collaborative, Empowering and Motivating.

Malin is an ICF-certified business and leadership coach with a passion for helping individuals unlock their full potential and live their best lives. As a former professional athlete and author of the book “Mental Strength”, Malin brings a unique level of curiosity to the coaching process, believing that small steps can eventually lead to-life changing results. After multiple big life and career transitions, Malin made the decision to pivot from sports and into various corporate operation leadership positions before eventually becoming a coach. Malin Is dedicated to supporting others on their journey to reach their goals in all areas of life.

Manon believes that people connected to their inherent potential can forge a new direction and change almost anything. She draws on nearly two decades of collective experience as a certified coach, and as a project director and team lead in the brand marketing space in New York. With her open, honest and effective approach Manon positions you to advance—to carve out a competitive edge that leads the pack. Manon promotes a safe and positive coaching partnership that challenges and champions you—and your team—to continually push toward excellence. Whether your goals are personal or professional, she makes achieving and excelling them possible. Accomplishments include the following: 3500+ coaching sessions with 500+ unique clients, ICF credential in Advanced Team Coaching, (ACTC),Emotional Intelligence EQ-i 2.0 and EQ360 Assessment Certification, Systemic (Team) Coaching Supervisor and I teach Foundational and Advanced Group Coaching Courses at the Group Coaching Institute.

Marek was born in Poland and moved to the United States when he was fourteen. He graduated from West Point in the top 10% of his class. Upon graduating from the US Army Ranger school, Marek served in the 82nd Airborne Division for six years, which included deployments to Iraq as well as Afganistan. Upon honorable discharge from the armed forces, Marek spent a decade in various leadership roles on multi-billion dollar projects at locations ranging from Angola to Shanghai while working for ExxonMobil. Marek is currently an Executive Coach who specializes in building up leaders that everyone wants to follow.

Educated as a psychologist, Maria has worked in mental health and for a social work organization, setting up programs to support mental health. She became a trainer in communication and for the last 15 years Maria has been extensively trained and worked with people using the approach of Inquiry Based Stress Reduction (IBSR), also known as The Work of Byron Katie. It is a way to come home to oneself and with that it opens the door to inner wisdom and new perspectives, making it such a valuable way of working for her. Communication skills and working with feedback are also topics she has a great interest in.

Mariana is an executive and career coach with a specialization in Positive Psychology who's worked across various industries such as executive search, hospitality, F&B and fashion. Her life and professional experience, going through career transitions, and starting her business, help her assist people to find what they really want out of life and their careers to design an action plan with their next steps. From new leaders to executives, entrepreneurs & individual contributors, she thrives when helping them design meaningful and thriving lives and careers. Mariana's international exposure allows her to coach in Spanish, English and Italian.

Mariel’s personal mission is to ignite transformation in individuals and teams in their journey towards breakthroughs and discoveries through Coaching. She has professional coaching experience in the field of sales management and leadership. She has partnered with leaders of different levels in the growth, development and expansion of their teams. Mariel’s coaching impact as described by one of her coachees is summarized in this one statement, “the life of a person is measured not with years, but with the footprint the she leaves in other people’s lives, thoughts and hearts.”

A behaviouralist at heart, Michele H. Cohen works at the intersection of business and human behavior as an Executive Coach, advisor and consultant for successful professionals and businesses. Michele is a highly experienced International Executive Coach who supports successful professionals from across the globe at all stages of their careers, serving entrepreneurs to growth stage start-ups to leaders at Fortune 500s. Prior to launching her coaching practice Michele worked as an international business consultant driving growth for SMEs. She partnered with companies from almost every industry imagineable and worked on projects in over 50 countries. Michele has a BA in Economics from Cornell University and a Masters in International business from ESIC. Michele coaches individuals, teams and organizations to transformative growth. She also serves as an advisor for high growth companies, collaborates on projects in applied behavioural science and volunteers her time as a mentor for up and coming talent. Michele loves working as a Bravely Pro because of the wide variety of clients she is able to serve. The on demand coaching philosophy of Bravely is a unique and effective way to use coaching to support employees in the moments that matter.

Paolo brings over 15 years of experience in the learning and talent development space working in 13 different countries in 4 different languages. These different experiences have given him the opportunity to train, facilitate an coach employees and entrepreneurs through a wide range of cultures and backgrounds leaving him today where he started: indescribably passionate about helping people grow and express their talent to the fullest. Paolo holds a Master’s degree in Foreign Modern Languages and Literatures from the University of Milan in Italy. Paolo lives with his family in North Carolina where he enjoys nature, cooking Italian and learning from anyone he meets.

Priya is a Happiness, Life Transformational, Leadership Coach and a loving mother with 25 years’ exp with Standard Chartered Bank Group spanning across Operations, Automation & Project Implementation, Relationship Management and Customer Service before she took a break, she served as Sr. Vice President for 4 years. Priya then moved from Corporate to Coaching and have been coaching people and supporting them to achieve a higher level of excellence and happiness. Priya is also a Director in a premium training start-up - Academy for Bankers She loves coaching employees at every stage of their career, from entry level to the Executives.

Quianna Rodriguez is an Air Force Veteran and certified coach who empowers professionals to successfully navigate their career journeys. Whether it's Career Development or Career Planning, she thrives on developing people and uncovering what's next in their careers. The results are creating focus, direction, and achieving career success. Quianna's personal career journey has taken her from the military to being an Information Security Specialist/Technical Writer, to an Educator, and now a Certified Coach. While being a Career Coach for the last 10 years, she's had the opportunity to work with individuals and organizations such as TIAA-CREF, BA Women's Alliance, and The Sadie Collective. For Quianna, it's always been about people and she's grateful to have the opportunity to make a difference in their lives by doing what she loves. Quianna holds a Degree in Education and 7 Coaching Certifications. She is a proud mother of 3 and a lover of nature and sports.

Quinn is passionate about helping people in finding clarity and confidence to pursue meaningful impact in personal and professional life. She holds an Associate Certified Coach credential from International Coaching Federation. She was in sales and distribution management before moving on to head a regional team in a tech firm. After beginning to help others with overcoming challenges using their strengths, and aligning their personal and professional growth, she shifted her career focus to coaching. She now works with clients to deepen awareness of their own beliefs, values, and inner resources to attain transformation in life and work.

Rachael Arthur is an experienced teacher, facilitator, coach, and consultant with specialization in life, leadership, and career coaching. She holds a B.A. in Business Administration and Marketing from Texas A&M University, and a certificate in Executive Coaching from New York University. She is a StartingBloc Social Innovation and Entrepreneurship Fellow—a program that develops leaders who are committed to positively impacting the world through collaborative problem-solving, inclusion, and creativity, and she is also a graduate of the Landmark Forum and Advanced Course—an immersive training program that teaches people how to produce extraordinary results and enhance the quality of their lives. Rachael draws from these experiences to coach individuals towards navigating life with courage, intentionality, and authenticity.

Drawing on over 20 years of global leadership experience across tech, banking, consulting and retail, Rahim has thrived in fast paced, innovative organizations from Apple to IBM, CIBC and WestJet Airlines. He is a former Board member with the City of Toronto (Yonge Dundas Square) and former Customer Advisory Board Member for Adobe. Rahim has also volunteered in Central Asia for the Aga Khan Agency for Habitat. As an executive coach, Rahim uses his depth of intuition, compassionate empathy and an edge for surfacing the truth to create new pathways of discovery for his clients ranging from executives to emerging leaders and high potentials.

Rebecca has over 24 years of global consulting, organizational development, and program management experience with a focus on business strategy, leadership development, and organizational culture. She began her career in the United States Air Force, later worked for the state government, and then shifted over to the Technology industry. Rebecca holds a M.S. in Information Management and is Project Management Professional (PMP), Prosci Organizational Change Management, and Brain-Based Coaching certified, to name a few. She is passionate about helping others accomplish their goals, realize their full potential, and resolve issues in the ever-changing world of work. She specializes in helping individuals in transition to include military veterans and those seeking role, career, or life changes. She was drawn to Bravely’s mission to make life at work better for everyone.

With her 15 years of HR and recruitment experience, Renee has a passion for helping employees navigate the ever-changing world of work and helping them prepare for new opportunities with strength and courage. As a certified organizational coach (ICF-ACC), Renee uses strengths-based techniques to create remarkable transformations in mindsets, behaviors, and careers. Based in Asia for over 10 years, previously, Renee held senior HR roles in Fintech and Investment Banking (Barclays, UBS) in New York, Singapore and Hong Kong. Renee writes frequently about the future of work and people trends on Linkedin and is a highly sought after emcee and panelist at leadership, talent and innovation events. She loves coaching at Bravely because she believes in the democratization of coaching and creating coaching opportunities for every employee at every level.

Rhonda L. Bowen is a global strategic communication guide with over 30 years’ experience in communicating across cultures. As an American who has lived in Germany since 1983, she has worked with people from more than 70 countries. Her business, established in 1988, has brought insights and support to thousands of BEST professionals (business, engineering, science and technology). She supports these clients in becoming more effective and efficient in their communication across cultures. Her work with her clients saves time, resources and effort and leads to better results and higher success in achieving business and personal goals.

Rita Hausken has coached hundreds of women on how to take their seat at the leadership table and confidently share their ideas and visions. For 20 years, Rita worked as a Sales Director in Upstream, covering the oil & gas industry. She led teams of 20+ people and navigated them through some of the worst economic downturns. Now, Rita is on a mission to help women and men ensure that busyness, stress and pressure don’t hijack their lives, and instead, to let their innermost values and vision guide them and be at the forefront of everything they do. Founder of Shestainability, she is a Strategist, Leadership Coach Advisor and Speaker.

Robin is a certified professional coach who focuses on helping leaders strengthen their core and improve the impact they have on others and loves seeing leaders find the joy in leading others. With over 20 years of corporate experience in various talent management roles, she brings great perspective and insight along with her coaching and leadership development expertise. Her experience spans diverse sectors including energy, chemical and refining, and healthcare. As a coach, her vision is to be the trusted partner you value for being authentic, curious, and having an unwavering belief in your ability to make an extraordinary impact.

Saskia Houwing is a skilled coach working alongside mid-career individuals and leadership teams to bring radical change, progress and growth. Dedicated to your personal and professional transformation, she provides powerful insights that enable long-term success. Saskia’s warm and considered approach to the health of your business nurtures workplace relationships, improves communication, and enhances synergy and cohesion to promote high-value teams and enter-prise resilience. Several organizations and recognized events have benefitted from her expertise including global and fi-nancial law firm Chugh, REI, Chateau Ste. Michelle Wine Estates, University of Washington, TEDxSeat-tle, Open Innovation Academy (Netherlands) and Deloitte (Netherlands). Saskia’s deep understanding of diversity—character, capability and cultures—makes her exceptional at identifying and optimising unique qualities. She is passionate about supporting individual voices and strengths. As lead coordinator for TEDxSeattle—one of the most successful TEDx chapters worldwide—Saskia estab-lished TEDxYouth and quickly carved out a reputation as a thoughtful, trustworthy and invested leader. Gifted now, as she was then, at creating safe spaces for others to speak up and thrive in, Saskia supports teams to fearlessly ideate, innovate and soar. As a progressive coach, Saskia is future focused and action based, gearing businesses for sustainable success by helping teams pivot to their goals and establish effective practices. Her trusted coaching methods equip individuals and teams to connect the dots, gain new perspectives that overcome road-blocks and remain proficient in volatility. Clients flourish under Saskia’s guidance and are empowered to shift their thinking, identify their potential, recognise new possibilities and experience breakthroughs. Her openhearted, kind, and nonjudgmental manner positions you and your business to prosper. Working with Saskia individually or corporately is a deeply rewarding experience with far-reaching impact. ACCREDITATIONS International Coach Federation (ICF) Certified European Mentoring & Coaching Council (EMCC) Certified Certified Global Team Coach (ITCA) Certified Positive Intelligence Coach (CPQC) Certified Tilt 365 strengths- based personality Assessor Certified Coach, Accomplishment Coaching (ICF/ ACTP) Certificate Science of Wellbeing, Yale University

Sean brings his more than 20 years of global organizational management consulting to his coaching practice. He has worked with organizations and individuals around the world to improve their competency and capability.He has also been a university lecturer in management and leadership. As a coach his passion is on using pragmatic and proven coaching techniques to deliver real lasting change, clarity of issues and help with life decisions. He works with individuals from a wide variety of backgrounds and at many different points in their lives and careers.

Selena is an ICF Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with 15+ years of experience, helping leaders and employees through career change and personal development. Her corporate human resources experience spans across various roles including generalist, talent, HR development and project management for multinational brands in the retail and hospitality sectors. In 2019 Selena became aware that something was missing from her life and career. This awareness kick-started a period of transformation which led her to retrain as a coach, connecting her work with her beliefs, values and strengths. She now works with clients to help them clarify their own beliefs, values and strengths to be able to reach their goals. Selena’s coaching style can be described as calm, collaborative and straight-forward. Selena is originally from the U.K. and lives in Hong Kong where she enjoys running, hiking and of course, the city’s famous dim sum.

Selika is an ACC certified coach by the International Coaching Federation with a 10 year-background in Marketing and Communications for Art Institutions. In her coaching practice she has been working with personal clients as well as teams in a corporate setting. She loves to help her clients navigate change, gain awareness of personal value and executive presence, as well as improve their communication skills and maintain integrity and authenticity while gaining flexibility and openness. She a is a long-time meditation and yoga practitioner, bringing mindfulness techniques and energy work into her coaching practice.

Sezen is a Associate Certified Coach (ACC) by International Coaching Federation (ICF). She has 15 years International Companies experience in Human Resources and Business Administration. She has Master Degree in HR Management. She has an experience in Executive & Career coaching, recruitment, performance management, training & development, conflict management, People management, motivation, administration. She loves coaching employees at every stage of their career to bring out their best versions. She supports People to build better relationship and improve communication. Her motto is: ‘’ Great things never came from comfort zones.

My name is Shadiyah Jones. As your coach, I am here to help you understand the transitions or the moment you are going through. My ability to ask thought-provoking questions and to create a safe space will allow you to innately find the answers to the questions you have been asking and desiring to know. I like for my sessions to go in an organic process that enables the client to have those "aha moments"that will bring clarity, empathy, and answers that the align with your understanding.

Sherry Feldberg is an executive coach and consultant with industry expertise in biotech and communications/public relations. At Bravely, Sherry guides professionals to navigate complex workplace, career and leadership challenges. Her ability to meet people where they are and help them see possibilities instead of only problems is what differentiates her coaching style. Sherry previously enjoyed a 20-year career in healthcare communications leading award-winning PR Agency teams and serving as Director of Corporate Communications at Alkermes, a global biopharmaceutical company. Sherry’s responsibilities in these roles – preparing executives for high-stakes engagements, collaborating with cross-functional leaders, building consensus to advance organizational goals, developing talent and inspiring teams to deliver impactful results – create natual opportunities to connect authentically with clients and, ultimately, guide them to crush professional and organizational goals. Sherry earned a B.A. in Political Science from Union College. Professional credentials include certification as an Executive Coach from the Center for Executive Coaching; certification as an Accredited Partner to administer the Smart Collaboration Accelerator assessment program from Gardner & Company; and aPHR certification from the Human Resources Institute (HRCI). Outside of her work as an executive coach and consultant, Sherry enjoys spending time with her husband and two children, ages 10 and 13. An advocate for self-care, Sherry makes time for activities that “fill her cup,” including rigorous strength and conditioning workouts, binging on the latest drama series and catching up with friends. She also engages in meaningful volunteer work, including serving as a Mentor for the Mazie Mentoring Program, an affiliate of Big Brothers Big Sisters of America.

Shruti is an Associate Certified Coach from the International Coach Federation and a Certified Professional Coach from the International Coach Academy (Australia). She has an MBA from the Kelley School of Business (USA), and a background in Technology and Innovation Consulting. As a Coach, she loves being a catalyst on the personal leadership journeys of her clients as she partners with them in the pursuit of meaningful impact that really matters to them. She has coached clients across small businesses, foundations, law firms, consulting firms, non-profits, healthcare, education, media and technology companies including Fortune 500 companies.

I’m a Certified Co-Active Professional Coach(CPCC) with completion of training with CTI, with a strong background in global business expansion and international team management across multiple global markets. I work with C-level leaders and entrepreneurs from start-ups to Multinational Corporations around the world on their personal and professional transformation through clarifying their vision and empowering their inner resources. I’ve spent a dozen years in consulting and venture-scaling industries in Asia, with the most recent venture being spearheading WeWork’s expansion to South Korea and Southeast Asia.

Professional Certified Coach (PCC); (ECPC) MFA French Language and Literature After three decades of serving in the spaces of human potential and science writing, starting in Europe, Sophia now runs a full coaching practice to support creative, entrepreneurial and executive professionals in their deepest flourishing. She loves to guide people in reclaiming their capabilities, to dare to embody compassionate, effective leadership, to own their contribution and aliveness. With ease, belonging, clarity. She also loves meditation, and long roaming walks. Her go to: “Our deepest humanity is our highest possibility.”

A veteran educator and career development professional, my coaching focus is career transition and personal development strategies. An inveterate explorer, I believe each of us can find the path to personal and professional success and fulfillment. My purpose in our relationship is to provide support and guidance in that discovery process. I spent the bulk of my professional life in medical education and student services at both Texas Tech University and within The University of Texas System specializing in academic performance and career advising. I hold a bachelor’s degree in natural science from Texas Tech University and a master’s degree in leadership and ethics from John Brown University.
